website_summaries.verdict: A quality keyboard that has nice features for gamers or those who want something more than a standard keyboard.
pros: A mechanical keyboard that features a detachable soft-touch wrist rest, a roller volume control with mute, USB port, and anti-ghosting technology that keeps up with every keystroke
cons: The keys can be a little too sensitive

customer_reviews.title: I understand now...
customer_reviews.text: When people tried to spread the gospel that is mechanical keyboards I use to think "this person is just trying to explain away throwing away +$100 on a keyboard." But now I understand. Before this my most expensive and used keyboard was the Logitech Mk550. I was content with using that forever but eventually it just stopped working (even with fresh batteries). So I finally decided to try out a mechanical keyboard. God! It feels so good to type on. That and sound makes me feel like I'm doing important work - even when writing a review on Amazon that only 5 people would see.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C

customer_reviews.title: upon first glance it was nice. but when I used I was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Package delivered earlier but it took 3 days to be shipped. Keyboard arrived saturday, I was so excited to use it. I read reviews on it hoping it was what they say it is. upon first glance it was nice. but when I used I was disappointed. Rapidfire was sensitive but it doesnot feel good when typing. sometimes the lights is not well balanced through out looking like bricks at time, a need restart would fix the problem. Maybe I got a defective product but I don't know. Maybe it the preference differs from person to person.. But for me I did not like it.
customer_reviews.author: allnamesweretaken

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is super well built and looks amazing. The keys provided nice clicks and it's super easy to type on. Keys come out relatively easy but not too easy that I do it on accident, you know? The LEDs are nice, the software is easy to use and even comes with macros and such. Has a 3 brightness dim button on the keyboard which is nice. The media controls are super nice and have a premium feel like the rest of the board. The USB passthrough works great althought it makes for a really thick USB cable which is somewhat difficult to cable manage, but not a huge deal. No regrets with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Good mechanical keyboard. Price could be lower though.
customer_reviews.text: Although somewhat expensive for a keyboard, I've noticed that it's actually very sensitive. Initially I hated typing with it because I was making more typos with it. However, what I've noticed is that as I break the keyboard in I'm actually getting used to it, and its highly responsive. If you're looking for a quieter keyboard this is not for you since you will be hearing that click clack that the mechanical keyboard makes. Somehow I think it's going to be years if not a decade before this thing breaks down.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Average

customer_reviews.title: Really Sensitive but beautiful and ecstatically pleasing
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing I can say I dislike about this keyboard, just takes a little time to get used to since it's so sensitive but once you get comfortable with it, you type 2x faster unless that's just me, since i'm a gamer, this K70 Keyboard helps me out a lot pulling out my weapon or item faster, just small things add up to make it so much better than other keyboards I had or seen. Totally worth the price even though it's a bit pricey, highly recommend it if you play a lot of video games.
customer_reviews.author: Eryk Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard came in the box only, i think i was supposed to choose hide content hmmm. The box looked open already but all the contents were inside. I wish it did not have all the UPS tags on it. The keyboard matches my Corsair headset and mouse so i am very happy about that. Types very nice, lettering is bold and easy to see. The KB is very sturdy and well built and it also has 2 usb 3.0 plugs that go to your computer that's why the cordage is so thick. Great product and will recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Zeek

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying but it has DURABILITY ISSUES!
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this keyboard for a couple of weeks now and i have to say its pretty good as it is realy fast and it has a satisfying feeling. BUT ive played 5 hours a day for the past two weeks (mainly CSGO) and the keys WASD which are the main gaming keys are changing with only two weeks of use. They are not as satisfying to click as the other keys I know it is because im using them alot but for a 150$ i expected more durability!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't Sure, But Now Love It
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to a mechanical keyboard from a regular Bluetooth piece of crude. The quality and response is amazing and perfect. It's not terribly loud, which was my biggest concern. PC is in the living room and If the door to the bedroom is closed, then whoever is in the bedroom can't hear them. (Basically what I needed) Would buy again. Expensive but worth it. The girlfriend was very mad after she realized how much I spent on the keyboard. But she plays more pc games than I do (mainly WOW). She's warmed up to it and I can tell she actually likes it even though she won't admint it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming, okay for typing
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard looks and feels great for gaming. Its got the turn off windows key button so you don't accidentally minimize a game with sausage fingers, and the Corsair software lets you program macros and such. However I am studying Computer Science and as such have to do a lot of programming work, and writing code with this can be frustrating for some reason, I have trouble consistently hitting the { } ( ) - _ + = \ " ' keys when I code compared to other keyboards, but outside of that it's a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer of Things

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE this keyboard! I love the sensitivity of the keys (comes in handy for school as well as gaming). I love the huge selection for lighting options. Comes with different W A S D keys if you choose to use them; also came with the detachable bottom extender wrist rest thing, not sure what its called, but I like the material and its really sturdy when being attached, I don't feel like its going to break if I move the keyboard, same for the feet on the bottom of it which normally break super quick, but these don't seem like they're going anywhere. Super worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kate O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've had
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Weighty and very solid. Clicky, oh so clicky. I love it. Beefy woven cord. I feel like this keyboard would survive about anything you could throw at it. RGB lighting is good and bright with lots of presets. The keys are removed easily with the supplied tool to make cleaning easy and thorough. Cons - No USB 3.0 pass through. I'm getting to picky. It was hard to think of a con. Overall - WORTH EVERY PENNY.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this keyboard for over a month, it does feel a lot different than my previous keyboard, it has pretty easy access for cleaning dust, not to mention that it is beautiful, the keys feel amazing, LEDs can be reconfigured on different profiles, etc... **CONS: 1. If I had to complain, I'd say it comes with two USB connections, which I still don't know why, and I should probably do my own research on this. 2. Every now and then I have to reset my keyboard on BIOS mode or it won't boot up, probably an issue with my configuration, or probably an issue with a keyboard, I didn't have to do this before.
customer_reviews.author: Rax

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the K70 for 6 months now. I absolutely love it. The Rapidfire keys are very crisp and quick. I am not a fan of the whole RGB/LED fad, but it is nice that everything is completely customizable. I have only "WASD" lit up. The keyboard is easily cleaned and the typography used on the lettering is really neat. The wires are a heavy gauge and can probably take more abuse than I will ever throw at them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good for FPS
customer_reviews.text: Awesome keyboard. Great feel, sound, lighting and extra features. ...Although I feel it would be better for first person shooters. Since the activation is very short and non-tactile, I sometimes press a key I didn't mean to. Playing a monk in WoW, that means accidentally Cocooning a party member or Torpedoing myself off a bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Du D.

customer_reviews.title: What more can be said?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard after gaming on a Saitek membrane-based one for 8 years. This is the first mechanical I've ever used. WOW what a difference. It's a heavy, durable quality keyboard. You can customize keycaps as well, since it's the Cherry MX family! I love the Speed switches! Not only do they feel amazing, I tend to type light and I love that I don't have to press keys all the way down for them to actuate. The click noise is VERY satisfying but not overly loud like some other switches. Would recommend this board to anyone wondering if mechanicals are worth it. They are!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ( I was very excited to use it but unfortunately I was disappointed: '(
customer_reviews.text: When I used it for the first time all the lights were on then turn off, and It no longer works again and more than that the keyboard has become an electric seam!! Not that strong but i can not used it for long time, I do not know what the problem is! I changed the cable and moved to another room I thought the problem was at home but it is not :( I was very excited to use it but unfortunately I was disappointed :'(
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I am the Destiny 2 strafe god now
customer_reviews.text: All my clanmates are jealous of my keyboard. Throw on a Dire Promise or Midnight Coup and oooooooooh LAWD I can ADAD spam like no one's business. Main reasons why I love and recommend this board: - Build quality. Enough said. - Not too loud keys, but satisfying sound - Doesn't feel like you're stressing your hands/fingers after long hours of play - Not too bad for typing either - 1.2mm actuation is just nuts man, it's NUTS - Corsair software isn't as awful as it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard just wish the keys clipped in better
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very good and I’ve been using it for about a year now The leds look good and are very bright, the keys are very responsive and not too clicky, the software was easy to set up with endless customization options. The only downside to this keyboard in my opinion is that the keys pop out too easily, if I drop a heavy box or bump the edge of my desk and the keyboard bounces practically all the keys fly out and then I have to spend a couple of minutes putting them all back in the right place
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Works for a few months then shorts out
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard worked fine for about 5-6 months then the led lights slowly started flashing rapidly and would only show red. Now about 2 years in the keyboard keeps shorting out and typing on its own it. It would endlessly type <|BCMNVXZ< over and over. This seems to be a common issue with the older keyboards. If you search that string of letters it leads right to this keyboard. I wanted to like it but for 139 dollars that I paid I can not and will not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my son. He likes to use it for gaming on his PC. He absolutely loves it and it was cheaper here than at Best Buy. The keys are very satisfying to type on with a very robust clicking sound. The lights are very cool, you can program them to make different colors and patterns (instructions included, it's easy). I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Walles

customer_reviews.title: Lighting up your game ...typing needs practice
customer_reviews.text: For gaming, response is awesome, rollover, no ghosting, etc. perfectly happy. For typing, the response is almost too sensitive. Clearly needs practice to type on it. But that was to be expected. Would be cool, if one could set different modes easily, as not to end up with 5 instances of the same letter when lifting the finger too slowly. The light show application works well, and interesting effects can be done. Like with all of those things, they are not essential, but add a nice touch
customer_reviews.author: JackD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard. Before this keyboard I had only used ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keyboard. Before this keyboard I had only used membrane switches and I can not go back. Since getting it i have had to use membrane keyboards and the difference is insane, the situation point on this keyboard is so high and the amount of force needed is so low it's like typing on air. And they sound of typing with it is like music to the ears. If you can afford to pick one of these up I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Had
customer_reviews.text: One THE most comfortable and convenient keyboards I have ever used. One of my coworkers who is far from gaming even noticed the comfort. Let me tell gaming hardware is the best for many computer applications beyond gaming. I do a lot of productivity work with a "gaming" computer with a lot of gaming peripherals and it is truly life altering. Many people over look these tools as they are marketed to gamers, but I find them very helpful for programming, photo applications and much more.
customer_reviews.author: Saeed M

customer_reviews.title: this keyboard is amazing. took my gaming to a new level
customer_reviews.text: this keyboard is amazing. took my gaming to a new level. the keys feel really good and are very responsive. the color combinations are endless and the pad to rest your wrist helps out alot. I also love that it has a volume button that other gaming keyboards don't have. I really recommend this keyboard for anyone looking to game. It even came with extra keys that have a rough feel to them in case you need more grip during intense matches. I am very satisfied with the build quality and look of this product. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect unit but space bar sounds an feels "loose" -"rickety." Give the tightess of all other aspects of this, I find this inconsistent wih the otherwise overall, ultra high quilty fit and design. Everthing is tigh thern you hit that space bar. Maybe needs 2 cherry reds on that not just one. This flaw is very annoying!!!!! Why not get it right. My other keyboard is a DAS and they nailed it. Look at what they did. So everything thing else on the K70 is A+ and the space bar is a solid D+.
customer_reviews.author: HoldenRider

customer_reviews.title: First Timer
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying a mechanical keyboard and using one so I didn't know what to expect. However I can actually say this keyboard is great. The quick fires do take some time to get use to and is very sensitive but for shooters, you will have no problems. I'm a sucker for RGB too so the colors and settings are awesome! I bought it mostly for both shooters and MMOs and it works decently. I'm still getting use to Kb/M set up but I recommend these to ppl who are extremely hardcore and needs that quick impact. For casuals, I would recommend something more smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Aya

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, Atrocious Software
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works great, love the style, design, and feel of it. Only downside I have for that is the Caps/Num/Scroll lock lights on the top are just little tiny circular lights right next to each other. Since the Caps/num/scroll lock icons aren't lit, when it's dark it's hard to tell which one is activate or not. The software on the other hand has to be the worst thing I've ever used. It crashes almost every time I manually open it up (sometimes on startup), your changes often don't save, and it isn't very intuitive. Don't even bother with it, it's not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: FrostySprite

customer_reviews.title: K70 Rapidfire RGB
customer_reviews.text: Man, this keyboard is great. I'm typing on it right now. It's not good for typing though, I mean, it will do but if typing is your job then this is probably not for you. I would recommend something like the blue or brown if you want to type on it. For games though? I don't think it could be better! It takes some getting used to just how little you need to press the key for it to register but that means that you are pretty much guaranteed the key press while gaming. The lighting looks absolutely amazing and reproduces all the colors perfectly, something not all my RGB stuff does. It's also very comfortable and built extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: FortisProcer

customer_reviews.title: The keys are weak!
customer_reviews.text: After a year of having this keyboard the keys caps keep falling off. I cant clutch cause the damn keys fall off with when pushing at any other angle than up and down. At first the keys falling off was just once and awhile, but after daily use, they fall off every single freakin day. If you plan on gaming you should reconsider. Aesthetically this keyboard is nice AF bros. 1 star for looks!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Chin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this keyboard. The one I bought from Amazon was defective and the lighting effect was flickering. I ended up buying one from Fry's to test it side by side to be certain it was a faulty keyboard. Ended up returning this one to Amazon and keeping the one from Fry's. As for the keyboard itself. Amazing keyboard, I can tell it helps me slightly in gaming especially because I play a lot of FPS style games. Keyboard looks great too. I was worried I wouldn't type well with this keyboard but after using it for a month it's really solid. Love the different lighting effects you can download from people because I'm lazy!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: The product works great and does anything you want it to do
customer_reviews.text: The product works great and does anything you want it to do, but The customer service sucks so bad that if you have a problem with this keyboard you will never get a response back. I have a problem with the "A" key it always a pink color to it. I made a support ticket on 8/15/17. Nobody from corsair responded to my ticket until 10/16/17 and the only thing they said was noted. The ticket is still open and it is 11/06/17. Almost 3 months after the ticket has been open and still no response back.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan L.

customer_reviews.title: Software is junk
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is good, nice metal finish looks solid. The software is absolute joke. 1st attempt a crashed on installation. 2nd install attempt it got a macro error still cannot get past. The help desk suggest using an older version of utility that is nowhere to be found on the site. If it was not for the default color scheme being OK to use until they get their act together on the software side I would return it asap. Corsair should really look at their software team and compare to competition.
customer_reviews.author: Mariusz

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is a great keyboard! It's my first mechanical keyboard and I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a great keyboard! It's my first mechanical keyboard and I'm already noticing an improvement in WPM, response when gaming, and less discomfort in my wrists after a long session. It's well built and I can already tell it's extremely durable. The thick wire coat is will do wonders to protect the keyboard. The wrist wrest is a godsend, and the customization software is very user friendly. I am very glad that I decided to upgrade my old CoolerMaster keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolo P.

customer_reviews.title: I've had this keyboard for 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: So I remember picking up this keyboard 3 years ago when I got my first desktop computer. Back in 2017, this keyboard was quite a bit more expensive (almost 200 dollars); however, after doing some researching and reading reviews I decided to take the plunge despite the occasional "my keyboard light went out" review. I can happily say that I don't regret making this purchase at all. after all this time, not a single one of my keyboard light has gone out, everything is still very functional. Yes, it might get dusty after some time, but it doesn't bother me personally.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Luxury keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I slept on corsair for a while, but I'm glad I woke up. This keyboard is fascinating definitely high end and a pleasure to play with. The only real gripe that I have with this and it's not so much the keyboard itself but the software. Sometimes when I boot up the Corsair Utility Engine it doesn't detect that I have a Corsair keyboard connected so I'd ultimately have to restart Windows or disconnect and reconnect the keyboard itself.
customer_reviews.author: J4y_3l3cT

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this keyboard and the Corsair app to manage it is out of this world. I never get tired of typing on this keyboard, and it’s absolutely beautiful. The only reason I had to drop a star was that it is very expensive, and there are other competitors that have lower prices while still having great quality. However Corsair is still one of the most known brands so I see why they mark up their prices, also these switches are the real deal. So worth the money IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Turns out that they are amazing and satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of nervous about the Cherry MX Speed switches. Turns out that they are amazing and satisfying, at least for me. They are also a bit more quiet than the Razer's or MX blues, which I've previously have. It feels really good to type on, let alone game. The color profiles are really awesome, but that's just icing on the cake. No macro buttons are my only hangup, but I don't use them anyway, but I might have. I can always figure out other macros. This keyboard feels and looks like quality. The packaging was amazing. The software isn't as buggy as my Razer Blackwidow Ultimate.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: let me tell you this straight!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought k70 rapidfire on FEB 8 2018, today is NOV 23 2019. So, after 2 years of vicious typing why am i writing this review? if thats your question, answer is "I freaking love my keyboard". I wont use this at quiet workplace like mine but when i am at home and when i play my games or write my codes, i am on fire!!! I was realizing slowly and today i wrote this... get this keyboard if you need a serious gaming keyboard.. that's it .. no more questions!!!
customer_reviews.author: catalanmessiah

customer_reviews.title: ... this over a month and it is absolutely the best keyboard I have ever used overall
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this over a month and it is absolutely the best keyboard I have ever used overall. The overall build quality is amazing and feels very sturdy. I love how you do not have to push hard at all for the key to register and how fast it actually registers the key. Since I have gotten this keyboard I have noticed a giant increase in my typing speed. It is amazing for every day use. I use it for gaming and typing essays, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ExceedAlpha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, great quality. Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for over a year now. Never had a single issue. The keys are responsive and durable. The entire board feels strong and durable. The colors have stayed bright and vibrant. The software to change color themes is a little confusing at times but if you want to download and use profiles that are already made it's simple. I would definitely recommend this board. I've never used the passthrough usb port on the board, but the media keys and volume control are invaluable if you listen to music and multitask.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics all Day

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard and LED lighting.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome keyboard for gaming. This is mechanical and does have a loud clicking sound which I enjoy. This keyboard recognize micro clicking so be careful when typing. It does pick up on the slightest touch. The software is ok but needs to be better. I usually just leave it on 2 colors for my main keys. But the software allow you to do some pretty cool displays.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: By far the best keyboard I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I am a transcriptionist and needed a good keyboard for typing long hours, and this has been by far the best keyboard I've even owned. I know it's a gaming keyboard but it works great for what I need it for. I am excited to start typing every day because of the beautiful colors on the keyboard that you can customize as you like, plus has MACROS and that saves me a lot of time when I'm typing.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: feels nice to type on and delivers quick response
customer_reviews.text: feels nice to type on and delivers quick response. Wouldn't recommend for slow typers as keeping your finger on the key for too long will result in thisssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss, but overall the rapidfire keys work nice and seem a lot quicker than my old mx reds
customer_reviews.author: James Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard... until they stop working
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many many corsair products. All of them have been excellently designed and elegant looking. Unfortunately, I've had to RMA four different keyboards since the K95. Failing LEDs, key registering multiple presses, and with this keyboard, it random registers CTRL, ALT, SPACEBAR, and the select keys all randomy firing at once, which renders the keyboard unusable. I can only conclude that this is the result of exceptionally poor quality control, or, that I have horrible luck.
customer_reviews.author: D. T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest keyboard I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest keyboard I have ever owned. I have now had this for 3 months and I love it. I put a big emphasis on quality and the K70 hits all my metrics. The metal frame is extremely sturdy. The keys are put together well too. I love the colors, there is so much customization. I have a cat and get fur all over the place, removing the keys and cleaning this product is super simple. I have recommended this keyboard to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is absolutely amazing. The switches are extremely responsive and the beveled/textured keys given in the box to replace your WASD are very helpful in feeling your way across the keyboard without glancing at the board. This keyboard is of high quality and very durable, however the software used to adapt certain aspects of the keyboard has been giving me issues since day one and will not install properly from the website.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: If you aren't sure between Razer and Corsair, Corsair is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I was having a really hard time deciding between this keyboard and Razers rgb keyboard, after going to best buy and trying both of them out, I had to go with Corsair. It overall felt like a better board with faster input times, the leds aren't as bright, but while playing games, I keep getting distracted with them and they look amazing so I guess I didn't need them any brighter. The software to modify the keyboard lights is easy to use and has some cool effects. I keep my keyboard on ripple effect most the time.
customer_reviews.author: Colorstupid

customer_reviews.title: Definitely love tinkering with the lights and finding profiles online
customer_reviews.text: Definitely love tinkering with the lights and finding profiles online. The switches are very light and have a short distance to register. I'm actually bottoming out a lot less - and that's how I've been typing this whole time. Though the feeling is mushy, it's just something I've gotten used to.
customer_reviews.author: Flipsider

customer_reviews.title: Bright and well designed, but has a glaring flaw for everything that isn't pressing W, A, S, or D
customer_reviews.text: while i'd say this keyboard is well worth the price, it requires a time investment to get used to, and there will likely be a lot of people who find it extremely difficult to press the right keys on the first attempt, as the keys are so sensitive that merely resting your hand on the keys can set them off, so minor prods and adjustments that wouldn't normally set a key off often do. Other than this, it is an exceptional piece of computer hardware that feels nice to use and looks quite nice regardless of build or situation.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Gamer boyfriend is a happy clam!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my boyfriend who is a gamer. He was looking to purchase a cheaper mechanical keyboard. But after all the reviews and craze over this keyboard I just couldn't resist to buy it for him as a surprise. I'm happy to say he's a happy clam! He was super impressed with all the capabilities of this keyboard mainly the rapid response, design, and unique personal lighting (haha) and the fact that I chose it. Now, he won't stop playing games! Thanks! :)
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: The Corsair build quality is fantastic but a full tenkey keyboard was too big for ...
customer_reviews.text: The Corsair build quality is fantastic but a full tenkey keyboard was too big for my desk and the Cherry MX Speed switches a little too sensitive for my taste. My plan was to buy a a K65 with Cherry MX Brown switches, but that particular board is not available in the US. I ended up replacing this keyboard with a Cooler Master MasterKeys Pro S with Brown switches and it's been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard. Love the speed switches!
customer_reviews.text: After having owned the Logitech G810 for the past 6 months I wanted something different. I just could not get used to those Romer-G switches. I did like the actuation and key travel distance though. So my main reason for buying the K70 was because it had similar key travel. I was originally going to get the K70 with MX Brown's but decided to order the RapidFire. So glad I did! The keys feel great! Much better than I expected. I added white Corsair keycaps as well. K70 RAPIDFIRE RGB Actuation distance - 1.2mm Total travel distance - 3.4mm Logitech G810 Actuation distance - 1.5mm Total travel distance - 3mm
customer_reviews.author: Jaams

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, super sens keys
customer_reviews.text: Switch from a Razer Onarta. Speed switches are super sensitive, I'm getting used to it but it does cause for mis-hits. Its a good keyboard, not much different than most, just quick accuation.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie D

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this mechanical keyboard. I am a Master Technical Consultant in the IT Services industry and use it daily for long periods of documentation and collaboration work. Very comfortable, and I love the satisfying "click clack" of the keys. The back lit keys are a NICE bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, best high end product out there, and the color customization is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I have ever owned. The feedback from a mechnical keyboard is great and fast. The clicking you get at amazing, love the noise it makes after each key pressed. My only mild complaint is the price, other than that, I recommend this keyboard if you are looking for a solid keyboard with loads of features. The keyboard is high quality compared to any other keyboard on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo Mego Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: Busted Ctrl Key right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: While the keyboard looks wonderful and the RGB lighting is quite pretty, the unit I received today has a broken left ctrl key. Called Corsair and they said to get a replacement via Amazon, which is shipping out today. I want to love this keyboard but this is the second k70 I've had key issues with. If the replacement tomorrow​ has any issues, I'll be jumping ship to a Ducky Shine 5.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Smith

customer_reviews.title: I tried 3 different keyboards before purchasing this bad boy. This one has been my all time ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say this. I tried 3 different keyboards before purchasing this bad boy. This one has been my all time favorite. I have owned it since August 2016 and it has been flawless. I play CSGO, Dota 2, WoW, and Overwatch. I love the extra WASD keys it came with and the wrist guard. I also love the back-lighting and software that lets customize the colors. I would highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Devin D.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to all
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works well as advertised. No problems with it as of yet. RGB rapidfire, might take a few days to get used to the rapidfire keys if you haven't tried reds/browns before. All keys are replaceable, it comes with a key popper. Only con I can think of is it only has 1 usb pass through, but that is just my personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and great feeling keyboard! The downloadable software gives an almost unlimited color combination and the replacement rubberized keys are a nice touch. The keys have a solid feel and are very sensitive compared to other keyboards. The wrist support is small, but is acceptable. The only negative is the price. It's expensive for a keyboard, and I'm sure there are less expensive versions out there that are almost as good, but I am extremely happy with mine and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie89

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product. It is very high quality and i bought it on a discount. This product is a good way to enter the world of PC gaming. I like the mechanical vibe with the keys and the gamer font plus it also has a nice software for good customization. I would give it an A+
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesomeness. I love backlit keyboards and this has the amazing clicky feel of a mechanical keyboard. Really fast too. You can download patterns for your keys both background changing and foreground. Example, I have green sweeping background like matrix. I have foreground programmed to light every key I touch white and fade....while matrix thing happening at the same time. Its impressive and worth the $
customer_reviews.author: Karl K.

customer_reviews.title: The keys are super sensitive, you dont have to push all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is ok, very quiet for a mechanical keyboard. The keys are super sensitive, you dont have to push all the way down for them to register. My issue I had was that it was shipped in the original packing, no outer Amazon box or anything to protect it so the box came pretty beat up. Kind of worried about any damage to the contents. Looks like whoever shipped it literally grabbed it off a shelf and slapped a sticker on it with 0 cares given.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard by far
customer_reviews.text: My favorite keyboard by far. the keys are super lightweight and very easy to type with at fast speeds and have mid level noise somewhere close to the middle between the intentionally loud keyboards and the intentionally quiet keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Nixon James

customer_reviews.title: works well with mac after some customization
customer_reviews.text: doesn't really work well with macbooks, which may be obvious to some but for some reason I didn't even think of it. I have a 2015 macbook pro 13 inch. Took a bit of searching but theres a github account with software that allows you to use it with apple products and customize keys. They keys will be labeled wrong.. alt is cmd etc.. but it does function after set up. I needed to use a windows computer to do a firmware update
customer_reviews.author: conor bellchambers

customer_reviews.title: RGB if your into it.
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard like most all of corsairs stuff. key lettering is a little larger than the regular k 70 i'm used to. RGB lighting is really fun I have the RGB mouse and RGB mouse pad mm800 software liks them all together. The cherry switches are a little smoother and quieter than the regular k70 non RGB I have.
customer_reviews.author: Don Trail

customer_reviews.title: Go 4 it,  luxury and performance
customer_reviews.text: K70 Rgb. Ok I got this recently but heavily used. The pros are for fps games are awesome the response time is quicker, great push sound, and the customization are great, got in 2 weeks from gold to diamond in overwatch playing 2 hours daily aprox. Cons- not a bad one but you will have to get used to it when typing it really can make sometimes Doble key a letter, you'll learn to quick type with it in a week or so
customer_reviews.author: Jose Vega

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is my daily driver and the main pro of this keyboard is the sensitivity, one of the main cons is the sensitivity. It's pretty easy to accidentally press a key but once you get use to it's not so bad. As for the build itself, it is a very solid keyboard and the icue software is very easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: WASD. Buttons die fast don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $ 150.00 for this and it lasted 8 months. I play call of duty and wsad buttons died it n the garbage now. I will never buy over priced corsair agian!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Corsair hit a homerun
customer_reviews.text: Went from a Corsair k65 to a Razer keyboard big mistake so here I am back with Corsair products and the build quality and cherry mx speed switches are amazing. My Razer only lasted a month I had my k65 for years don't know why I ever switched away from Corsair lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Mike poland

customer_reviews.title: TOP OF MY LIST KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard and it's one of the coolest looking ones out there. The only problem I have with this keyboard is that since I'm heavy handed the RAPIDFIRE keys/actuation are just to sensitive for me. Don't get me wrong though, for certain people and certain games this is an essential tool to have, but I rather have your normal membrane or even just a regular mechanical keyboard. For now, I'm happy with my SteelSeries APEX 350
customer_reviews.author: Dunk

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best board I have ever used/owned. Coming from a Logitech G410 and Razer Blackwidow which are both amazing boards as well don't get me wrong, they just aren't in the same ball park as this. It just feels right, from the sound and feel of the keys to the overall aesthetics and build quality. My only Con with this board is the software, which was a little confusing compared to Logitech and Razer's. The price point is a little high i know, but it is definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: FRANKIEJ1238

customer_reviews.title: Its the best mechanical keyboard I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I did not know I needed this keyboard until I bought it. Its the best mechanical keyboard I have owned. Was using a CM quickfire TK and this was sort of an impulse buy as my quickfire functions fine, but I could not go back to it after using the K70 rapidfire. The aesthetics are amazing, the cherry Mx speed switches are amazing, the led and customization of the keyboard is top notch. If you are on the fence about whether or not this keyboard is a worthy upgrade I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the responsiveness of the keys and the colorful LED effects! This keyboard will last me for a very long time. Plus, it comes with interchangeable keys and a key remover so I can change out the keys depending on the game I play. The software makes it so I can change the pattern and colors of the backlit LEDs depending on how I feel! I highly recommend this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Moody

customer_reviews.title: I love how easy it is to hit keys with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to hit keys with the Cherry MX Speed keys and overall this is a very high quality keyboard. I just wish they gave you more of the contoured/textured key caps to put on the arrow keys and maybe a few #s.
customer_reviews.author: Tsubakixv

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Corsair is really great at making these rgb products. No one wants to pay this price but I do believe this keyboard is worth more then the price offered. I'm very satisfied how this looks with my rgb rig. I wouldn't change it for another. Also the mechanical keys aren't loud like other keyboards. Good job corsair!
customer_reviews.author: Edward R

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this keyboard as Typing on it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this keyboard as Typing on it, the clicky fast response time of the keys and easy to read key faces make it very precise for my taste. The best part of the whole thing is how easy it is to be able to read the keys during a late night gaming session and before you ask, yes. There is a HUGE difference between this and the basic keyboards I was using and I don't think I can ever willingly go back to a non-mechanical. Corsair did a great job with this keyboard and Im sure it will last me an eternity considering the thing is heavy and made mostly of aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: ... 2 star and not one is because i really loved this keyboard to death
customer_reviews.text: The reason why i am giving this keyboard a 2 star and not one is because i really loved this keyboard to death, just after 3 months of usage the LED lights went crazy and started flickering. It goes my eyes very annoyed and i could not focus. I tried everything i could to have it back to normal, update firmware, reset keyboard, changing usb ports, etc Nothing worked. I contacted corsair support to help me with the case and they were unresponsive. But thank god amazon support is letting me return the product. I lose around $10-$15 dollar charge but that's fine, i will look for another keyboard that won't bug for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy King

customer_reviews.title: It was a great idea. The keyboard itself is sturdy and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to try the K70 for a while and decided to finally bite the bullet and buy one. It was a great idea.The keyboard itself is sturdy and the keys are extremely responsive. The software took me a few minutes but it offers a great range of options to control both the settings and the color for the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Just started using the keyboard which came with half of the keys tumbling around inside. The #4 key and symbol does not work at all. Yea there is a 4 on the number pad on the right side but if I pay for something new and express shipping I expect it to work.
customer_reviews.author: S w

customer_reviews.title: This has to be one of the best keyboards I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I was using the Razer Blackwidow Chroma, and I will have to say. This has to be one of the best keyboards I have ever used... Its got everything you want. From the switches being super responsive to the keyboards pleasing looks. Its overall my favorite keyboard I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Faes

customer_reviews.title: It's a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, I've been a gamer for many years! The feel, the response time, and overall quality of the keyboard is worth the price! I love the LED colors and the APP that you could download! You can control the colors and motion.
customer_reviews.author: Amin & Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Heaven for fingertips
customer_reviews.text: +Sooo comfortable, materials are fantastic +Textured Spacebar & WASD area +not too loud (I added dampener rubber rings to my Rapidfire's A-Z keys) +RGB is really amazing compared to other brands +Volume control works without any software -Software is pretty complicated if you want to setup custom lighting -Cable is braided & thicker than a power cable -uses two USB ports
customer_reviews.author: FB

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the board is great, I personally did not like the rapid fire ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the board is great, I personally did not like the rapid fire keys though. I started to feel fatigue in my finger as the keys felt heavier than red browns and blues.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I have ever owned as far as feeling ...
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I have ever owned as far as feeling of the keyboard and the precision of the keys. I don't like that you need software installed and RUNNING to have custom colors, but I won't take away a star for it since I love the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very satisfying to type on, and bears the click-clack of all Cherry keyboards. Feels responsive, and is pretty simple to clean, but not the easiest. The RGB is easy enough to set up through Corsair's software, which allows for extensive customization. The build quality is very good, and the deck feels solid. Love the included wrist rest as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I may not be a keyboard connoisseur and this may be only my second mechanical keyboard owned, but I absolutely love it. The keys feel nice, if a little mushy at first if you're coming from tactile switches like I did. They are also extremely responsive which is great too. There are multiple lighting effects that all look fantastic and can sync with other corsair products, like the mouse I'm using. Lastly the extra keys are nice for games especially if your fingers get sweaty as the extra grip and sloped keys help.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Albee

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Hard to Maintain
customer_reviews.text: Like most keyboard, cleaning the gunk is absolutely impossible. This keyboard functions beautifully and works wonders. I like the silent mechanical especially since it's not too loud but still has some of that click* feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Lin

customer_reviews.title: but other than that it looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: the reason why im giving it a 3 star is because of the sofware.. whenever i turn on my computer, it doesn't detect the K70 it always go to K95 which is not my keyboard that's why i always have to reinstall the corsair utility engine. but other than that it looks awesome
customer_reviews.author: MarkBenavidez

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for the gamer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard... but don't have heavy fingers or it will trick you... Great for gaming, can really zap the bad guys. Excellent on line software package for setting colors etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. The keys feel nice and it looks ...
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. The keys feel nice and it looks great. The software is not intrusive or bothersome, and the keyboard works fine on the default color settings with it closed if you don't want it running. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark & Michelle Williams

customer_reviews.title: so close to 5 stars for me. The keys ...
customer_reviews.text: so close to 5 stars for me. The keys are squished way too close together compared to a standard keyboard. When you're used to a certain spacing for your whole life it really messes you up mid game. I hope they come out with another version that is a little bigger and has the keys spaced out properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. Like the M65 Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. Like the M65 Mouse, sometimes it doesn't get recognized by the software and RGB is whatever it is (is not controllable). But, the key action (I got the short action keys) and build quality are superb. I like it very very very much.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gaming keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned my keyboard for over a year now and this thing is a trooper! I game hard and use for work, the faster key strokes are really nice and its super durable. I really enjoy the the custom lighting features, macro's and the aluminum body, the caps are easy to remove for cleaning or custom caps. Its keys aren't nearly as loud as MX Cherry blues or browns.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Hadala

customer_reviews.title: King of Keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I got the K70 LUX RGB RAPIDFIRE keyboard It is amazing, the keys press so easily and there is a satisfying click to the keys. The corsair software is sub par but gets the job done. The construction of the keyboard is 10/10 with the aluminum and the removable wrist wrest. The media controls are a nice touch as well as the windows lock key(for gamers), you can also disable steam, origins, and uplay overlays with that key if you want. This is not a budget keyboard but you get what you pay for and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I don't like about it is that the keys are too sensitive. It works perfect for gaming but when I have to switch over to do business work I have to say I find myself hitting the delete button more than I normally would.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The experience I am having with this keyboard is really awesome. It really great I went with Corsair not other brands.
customer_reviews.author: clyde

customer_reviews.title: great overall keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I used this for over a year. All the leds and keys worked. each led is programmable through corsairs software
customer_reviews.author: Seagrams

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Just get it. I went from a Razer which was fine but just felt cheap for the same price this thing is build like a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Barraza

customer_reviews.title: I really love it!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible keyboard, fast, well built, the RGB illumination is really nice and have a lot of options to config, i really love it! But you have to take in consideration that this is a really sensible keyboard, the first days I pressed the space like 1000 thousands times by error.
customer_reviews.author: coldrazor

customer_reviews.title: click clack clack clack click clack. man, it ...
customer_reviews.text: click clack clack clack click clack. man, it took me a while to get used to this after just using regular keyboards. but now that im use to it, i want to replace the one i use at work with one.
customer_reviews.author: Zack M.

product_meta.title: CORSAIR K70 RGB RAPIDFIRE Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - USB Passthrough & Media Controls - Fastest & Linear - Cherry MX Speed - RGB LED Backlit
product_meta.description: The K70 RGB RAPIDFIRE gaming keyboard has Cherry MX Speed RGB switches backed by a lightweight, durable aluminum frame. Advanced lighting control and large font keycaps deliver dynamic, vibrant multi-color backlighting. Harness the power of CUE for sophisticated macro programming and dramatic lighting effects and animations. 100% anti-ghosting with full key rollover on USB helps ensure accuracy, so every keystroke translates directly into accurate gameplay. The USB pass-through port is positioned for uninterrupted game play and ready for your mouse or wireless headset adapter. Contoured, textured FPS and MOBA key sets keep you in control, and the Cherry MX Speed RGB switches give you linear response and fast actuation.
feature_bullets: Corsair’s fastest mechanical keyboard, ever. Keyboard Cable Type: Braided
100% anti-ghosting and full key rollover on USB / 100% Cherry MX Speed gaming key switches with ultra-fast 1.2mm actuation and light 45g force
Aircraft-grade anodized brushed aluminum frame for superior durability / Advanced lighting control and large font keycaps deliver dynamic, vibrant backlighting

CUE support enables advanced macro and lighting programming for virtually unlimited game customization. Compatibility and System Requirements - PC with 2 USB 2.0 ports Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, or Windows Vista
Detachable soft-touch wrist rest and dedicated multimedia controls / USB pass-through port for easy connections / Textured and contoured FPS/MOBA keycap sets
Keyboard Backlighting: RGB; Wired Keyboard with 104 Keys; Connectivity: USB 2.0 Type-A

specifications.Series: CORSAIR K70 LUX RGB RAPIDFIRE Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - USB Passthrough
